posts._title: Cordelia Dvorak – John Berger or The Art of Looking (2016)
posts.title: John Berger or The Art of Looking
posts.excerpt: John Berger: The Art of Looking BBC Four Sun 6 Nov 2016 10.30pm-11.25pm Art, politics and motorcycles – on the occasion of his 90th birthday John Berger or the Art of Looking is an intimate portrait of the writer and art critic whose ground-breaking work on seeing has shaped ourunderstanding of the concept for over …

posts.title: Suntan
posts.excerpt: Synopsis On a hedonistic Greek island, a middle-aged doctor becomes obsessed with a young tourist when she lets him tag along with her group of hard partying friends. IMDb

posts.title: La Sabina
posts.excerpt: A Brit named Michael, comes to Andalusia in the footsteps of an English writer disappeared in that area in the nineteenth century. The mystery, the charm of the place and the fierce beauty of local women catch him completely. Cultural and emotional shock have as a background to the legend of La Sabina, a mythical …

posts._title: Saeed Roustayi – Abad va yek rooz AKA Life+1Day (2016)
posts.title: Abad va yek rooz
posts.excerpt: The graphic account of a poverty-stricken family living in Tehran through the days before the youngest daughter of the family, Somaieh, is departing to start her marriage to a supposedly rich Afghan. While all members of the family have their worries about the wholeness of the marriage, she is struggling with her madly debilitating troubles …

posts._title: Mirjana Karanovic – Dobra zena AKA A Good Wife (2016)
posts.title: Dobra zena
posts.excerpt: Quote: Milena is a middle-aged wife and mother ensconced comfortably behind a gate in an upscale suburb of Belgrade. She quietly tends to her looks, dutifully cooks and entertains, and meets her friends for choir practice. She makes love with her husband and they socialize jauntily with a group of old friends. But unsettling realities …

posts._title: Various – Cinema16: European Short Films (Special US Edition) (1965 – 2005)
posts.title: Cinema16: European Short Films (Special US Edition) (1965 – 2005)
posts.excerpt: Quote: Cinema16 celebrates the short film by showcasing some of the best classic and award-winning shorts on DVD. posts._title: Akira Kurosawa – Ichiban utsukushiku AKA The Most Beautiful (1944)
posts.title: Ichiban utsukushiku
posts.excerpt: The Most Beautiful is a wartime propaganda film depicting the efforts of female factory workers in a precision-lens manufacturing plant. It is episodic and anecdotal and very documentary-like. Donald Richie records specific instances of documentary techniques borrowed principally from Russian filmmakers such as the austere and static composition of its scenes. This need not be …

posts.title: Iconockaut
posts.excerpt: Quote: Two lovers, a man and a woman, meet and separate in a timeless space.

posts.title: Cameraperson
posts.excerpt: Quote: A boxing match in Brooklyn; life in postwar Bosnia and Herzegovina; the daily routine of a Nigerian midwife; an intimate family moment at home: these scenes and others are woven into Cameraperson, a tapestry of footage collected over the twenty-five-year career of documentary cinematographer Kirsten Johnson. Through a series of episodic juxtapositions, Johnson explores …

posts._title: Charles Brabant – Les Possédées AKA Passionate Summer (1956)
posts.title: Les Possédées
posts.excerpt: Synopsis Story of the effect on three women living on an isolated farm when a man comes to live there. Agata, sa fille Silvia et la belle-sœur Pia exploitent une ferme perdue dans un coin de montagne. L’embauche d’Angelo, séduisant quadragénaire, va provoquer affrontements et rivalités amoureuses entre les trois femmes…
